description.message: Remove everything from the new tab page and display any image, gif or video in it as a wallpaper.

select_background_alert.message: To change settings of a particular background, select it from the "Backgrounds" section first.

automatically_set_last_uploaded_backgrou.message: Automatically set the last uploaded background as current

home_btn_is_visible_label_text.message: Show "Home" button in new tab page

install_help_chrome_text.message: Thank you for installing Clear New Tab! If your Chrome has a theme from the Chrome Web Store installed, wait till its background appears in the "Backgrounds" section, and then open the new tab to see it. Otherwise, you can upload your own background with the form below. If you need help on how to use the extension click on ? buttons or watch the video guide. Click to hide this message.

install_help_edge_text.message: Thank you for installing Clear New Tab! If your Edge has a theme from the Edge Add-ons store installed, wait till its background appears in the "Backgrounds" section, and then open the new tab to see it. Otherwise, you can upload your own background with the form below. If you need help on how to use the extension click on ? buttons or watch the video guide. Click to hide this message.

install_help_firefox_text.message: Thank you for installing Clear New Tab! You can install a theme from the Chrome Web Store or upload your own background with the form below. If you need help on how to use the extension click on ? buttons or watch the video guide. Click to hide this message.

back_up_help_text.message: Here you can download and restore a Clear New Tab data back up. All Clear New Tab data is included in the back up, including your backgrounds and custom HTML/CSS/JS. The Limit of the back up is 512 mb. If the limit is exceeded, not fitting backgrounds will be cut from backup during download.

scheduler_help_text.message:
Here you can create tasks. A "task" is a background scheduled to appear in the new tab at a certain date and time. To create a task, click on a background from the "Backgrounds" section, choose desired date and time and then click on the "Add new task" button. It's not necessary to choose a full date, you can choose a date of any specificity. Omitting "year" will make the task recurrent - it will run every year on a specified date and time. Omitting "Time" will make the task run at 12:00:00 AM on the specified date. The "Time" field is in 24-Hour format.

Examples:
March 2, 2023 13:00:00 - the task will run once on March 2, 2023 13:00:00 after which the task will be removed from the list.
March 2 - the task will run every year on March 2 00:00:00.
March - the task will run every year on March 1 00:00:00.
2 (day of the month) - the task will run on the 2nd of every month at 00:00:00.
Wednesday - the task will run every Wednesday at 00:00:00.
13:00:00 - the task will run every day at 1:00:00 PM.

Tasks can be reordered by dragging them. If two tasks are scheduled to run at the same time, the task closer to the end of the list will take priority. For example, if you have a task scheduled to run every Sunday and other at December 25, 2022, you would need to move the "Christmas" task lower than the "Sunday" task if you want to see the "Christmas" background instead of the usual "Sunday" background.

The minimum interval between tasks is 1 minute.

custom_code_help_text.message: Here you can put custom HTML/CSS/JS for the new tab page. The code here will not remove the functionality of backgrounds.

upload_background_help_text.message:
You can upload multiple files at once. If you upload with the "Browse" button, select multiple files before you click "Open". If you upload by drag and drop, select multiple files before dragging them.

Supported formats: png, jpg, gif, mp4, webm, ogg.

paste_background_help_text.message:
You can paste a direct link to an image or an image from the clipboard to this input. To get a direct link to an image right-click on it, select "Open image in new tab" from the context menu, go to the opened tab and then copy the link from the address bar. To copy an image to the clipboard right-click on it and then select "Copy image" from the context menu. Gif animation will not be preserved when you paste an image from clipboard, but will be presserved if you paste a direct link.

Supported formats: png, jpg, gif.

mode_chrome_help_text.message:
Theme background: when this mode is chosen, backgrounds of themes that you install in the Chrome Web Store will be automatically downloaded and appear in the new tab. In this mode, you do not need to upload your own backgrounds. If you uploaded your own backgrounds, use "One background", "Multiple backgrounds" or "Scheduled" modes.

One background: when this mode is chosen, the new tab will display one of the backgrounds you uploaded and chose as the current background in the "Current background ‚Ññ" input. Use this mode if you have uploaded your own backgrounds and want to see one of them in the new tab.

Multiple backgrounds: when this mode is chosen, the new tab will display one of the backgrounds you uploaded, changing it at a given interval. If you want to see a different background every new tab, set the "Change background every" select value to "1 Millisecond". Use this mode if you want to see all backgrounds you uploaded. This mode does not guarantee that backgrounds will be displayed at a certain date. If you, for example, want a specific background to be displayed on each day of the week, use "Scheduled" mode.

Random solid color: when this mode is chosen, the new tab will display a randomly chosen color, changing it at a given interval.

Scheduled: when this mode is chosen, the new tab will display a specific background(s) at the date and time you choose. Use this mode if you want the specific background(s) to be displayed at the exact time.

mode_edge_help_text.message:
Theme background: when this mode is chosen, backgrounds of themes that you install in the Edge Add-ons store will be automatically downloaded and appear in the new tab. In this mode, you do not need to upload your own backgrounds. If you uploaded your own backgrounds, use "One background", "Multiple backgrounds" or "Scheduled" modes.

One background: when this mode is chosen, the new tab will display one of the backgrounds you uploaded and chose as the current background in the "Current background ‚Ññ" input. Use this mode if you have uploaded your own backgrounds and want to see one of them in the new tab.

Multiple backgrounds: when this mode is chosen, the new tab will display one of the backgrounds you uploaded, changing it at a given interval. If you want to see a different background every new tab, set "Change background every" select value to "1 Millisecond". Use this mode if you want to see all backgrounds you uploaded. This mode does not guarantee that backgrounds will be displayed at a certain date. If you, for example, want a specific background to be displayed on each day of the week, use "Scheduled". mode

Random solid color: when this mode is chosen, the new tab will display a randomly chosen color, changing it at a given interval.

Scheduled: when this mode is chosen, the new tab will display a specific background(s) at the date and time you choose. Use this mode if you want the specific background(s) to be displayed at the exact time.

slideshow_help_text.message: When —Åhecked, background will change dynamically right in the tab you are in. When unchecked, background in previously opened new tab pages will always stay the same, even if current background has changed.

settings_context_help_text.message:
This setting controls the specificity of all remaining settings in this section. These settings are: "Background size", "Background position", "Background repeat", "Color of area around background" and "Video volume".

If "Global" is chosen, listed settings apply to all backgrounds.

If "Selected background" is chosen, listed settings apply only to the background chosen in the "Backgrounds" section. To choose a background click on it. After you have chosen a background, the "Settings context" select will automatically change its value to "Selected background", indicating that background is successfully chosen. In addition, in this settings context, all listed settings would also allow you to use "Global" value.

background_size_help_text.message:
Don't resize:
Keep original size of the background.

Cover the screen/browser window:
Resize the background to cover the entire screen/browser window, even if it has to cut a part of it from the edges.

Fit to the screen/browser window:
Resize the background to make sure the background is fully visible on screen/browser window.

Stretch to fit the screen/browser window:
Resize the background to maximum screen/browser window width and height. Doesn't preserve the aspect ratio of the background.

If the background of the theme you installed is too big or small and you want to resize it to fill the screen and leave no empty space, then "Cover the screen" option is recommended.

background_position_help_text.message: This setting allows you to move a background around within the browser window. It behaves the same way as the CSS property background-position.

background_repeat_help_text.message: This setting allows you to duplicate a background infinitely over Y and/or X-axis. It behaves the same way as the CSS property background-repeat.

color_of_area_around_background_group_he.message: Apart from the main function, this setting (in global settings context) also determines the color visible before any background is displayed when you open a new tab, so if you want to eliminate the "white flash" set this setting's value to a darker color.

home_btn_is_visible_help_text.message: Displays "Home" button in the new tab page that leads to the default new tab page.

go_to_home_page_title.message: Go to default new tab page
